title: (x) Patrick Norguet geometric sans logo - ITC Avant Garde Gothic {Dav}
content:
Hi guys can u help me identify the font of Patrick Norguet?

[www.patricknorguet.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103857/http:/www.patricknorguet.com/ "www.patricknorguet.com")

 [‹ Script in Puma advertisements](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103857/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15578 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Dwell magazine nameplate - (similar to) Trade Gothic {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103857/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15537 "Go to next forum topic")
author: seervision

comments.content:
Good, ol’ ’Avant Garde’, that is..  
_( And, ’Courier’.. :)_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103857/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Dav, I was about to disagree about Avant Garde, thinking that the ’k’ is not the right shape. The samples I was looking at were heavier weights and the arms of the ’k’ meet at the stem, but then I looked at the [lightest weight of Avant Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103857/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-avant-garde-gothic/extra-light/testdrive.html?s=Patrick+Norguet&p=60) and there was the right ’k’.

Good call. Sorry for doubting you ;-)

- Mike Yanega

_No problem, Mike.. :)_ Even I was doubting myself, when I checked for the ’regular’ / standard weights and versions.. :) _( But then I spotted the light weight, you found as well.. Maybe I should have linked, earlier.? :)_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20080408103857/http:/www.formlos.net/)
